author: P V
text:
The AIADMK government lacked courage to meet the PMK on a political turf and has thus resorted to backhand tactics to scuttle the PMK’s leap, said Anbumani Ramadoss here on Wednesday.

Close on the heels of the Madras High Court passing an interim stay on works at “VGP Thidal”, which is the scheduled venue for PMK’s State Conference, till Friday, the party’s Chief Ministerial candidate said theAIAMDK’s move was a lame attempt to browbeat the PMK owing to its growing popularity among the people. The conference is scheduled to be held on a private land on Vandalur - Urupakkal GST Road in Kancheepuram on February 14.

Speaking on the sidelines of local visit here, Dr. Ramadoss said the government did not object to the use of the venue for a political meeting when Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the Vanigar Sangam conference.

They should have objected 10 days ago when the High Court granted PMK’s plea to hold the conference. “They deliberately waited till the last, after all the preparations were made.”

Alleging that the TNPSC was filled with political appointments, Dr. Ramadoss said, “There is no woman, or a minority community member, and seven of the members are of same caste. It is a betrayal of the people of the State.”

On the political alignment, Dr. Anbumani said, “if a political alliance was forged, it will be based on a common minimum programme led by the PMK.”
title: AIADMK lacks courage to meet PMK on political turf: Anbumani Ramadoss
